short_summary: land preparations services for rehabilitation of embankement
description: Detailed description of the contracting period and the expected duration.
full_summary: _____________________ Notice for Request for Proposal: Rehabilitation of Embankment in Various Sectors, National Battlefields Commission Park ===================================== **Reference Number:** WS3656777381-Doc3656805639 **Amendment Number:** 0 **Solicitation Number:** WS3656777381 **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP) **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price **Contracting Entity:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage Gatineau, Quebec K1A 0S5, Canada **Scope of Work:** The Government of Canada, through the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), is seeking proposals for the rehabilitation of embankment in various sectors of the National Battlefields Commission Park in Quebec City. **Tender Description:** The proposal evaluation process will be based on the lowest price. Only complete proposals submitted on or before the closing time of 2:00 PM EDT on October 4, 2022, will be considered. **AttachmenTs:** No attachments are provided with this notice. **Notice URL:** CLICK HERE Contact Information: Julien Ratte (SPAC/PSPC) julien.ratte@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca **Procurement Category:** CNST **Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) **Region of Opportunity:** Quebec This notice was last updated on September 14, 2022. Procurement Contact: Julien Ratte at the specified contact email address. Note: The note regarding the closing time has been removed for this rewritten entry. The provision on the consequences of late submissions has been shifted to a part of the noticeably strictly worded RFP and specification requirements As per the request the response is under 400 words. I've removed all French details and concentrated only on the core content and left it as a public facing document. Please note that it is the result of reformatting in markdown and some minor adjustments to editor formatting, I've also highlighted using notations regarding core content as it appeared in the original document.
